pr_title: Add option to enable/disable event definitions

timeline.message:
Split up EventDefinitionHandler code into smaller methods

This should make it a bit easier to reason about the behavior.

Add #schedule() and #unschedule() methods to EventDefinitionHandler

Fixes #7497

Don't log an error if "releaseTrigger" doesn't do anything

This can happen if a trigger gets removed while a job is running. (e.g.
disable scheduling of a job)
We also don't check this in other places.
Allow conditional scheduling for event definitions in content packs

Add option to enable/disable event definitions and show scheduler info

Fixes #7497
Make it possible to create/update event definitions without scheduling
Add checkbox to enable/disable scheduling in event definition forms
Show scheduling status in edit summary

timeline.bodyText: A short javadoc about what this class does would be nice
timeline.author: mpfz0r
mpfz0r

replies.bodyText: I would keep it as it is. We use Map<String, Object> for these types of return values all over the place. 😄
replies.author: bernd

timeline.bodyText: If we want to be extra correct, we would also query for the type being EventProcessorExecutionJob.TYPE_NAME
timeline.author: mpfz0r

replies.bodyText: We this in several other places as well without the type. I think it wouldn't be possible that we have two event definitions with the same _id but different types. Since the _id has a unique index.
replies.author: bernd

replies.bodyText:
My concern was not duplicates, but the fact that we are the config document from other types doesn't have the field we are querying.
But I guess it's fine.
replies.author: mpfz0r

replies.bodyText: Hmm. But then we would just get no result from the query, no?
replies.author: bernd

replies.bodyText: yeah, unless someone creates a plugin that uses the same field name in its config, which is quite unlikely :-D
replies.author: mpfz0r

timeline.author: mpfz0r
mpfz0r

timeline.bodyText:
Couldn't' this also be done with StreamEx like in DBJobTriggerService?
Seems simpler
timeline.author: mpfz0r

replies.bodyText: No, unfortunately not. The "config" structure in JobDefinitionDto is pluggable so there is no method that I could use for the grouping key. (without converting the object to a map or JsonNode and access the key again)
replies.author: bernd

replies.bodyText: Okay, I tested this. Using the object mapper to deserialize the value and pick the config field isn't that hard. Less code than the aggregation.
replies.author: bernd

replies.bodyText: @mpfz0r I implemented it with StreamEx. Good catch!
replies.author: bernd

timeline.message:
Simplify DBJobDefinitionService#getAllByConfigField

Use StreamEx instead of a MongoDB aggregation.
Allow isScheduled to be used with content pack parameters
